description: A survey of German films from Caligari (1919) to The Counterfeiters (2008), this
course examines 20th-century German history through the lens of Germany's most renowned films.
Students develop analytical and critical skills in "reading" films as cultural products and as
cinematic works of art.  The course focuses on the increasing social and political importance of
mass media for understanding the past. Counts toward film studies concentration. May be counted
toward German major or German studies concentration.
